ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] How to Correctly Install Cantera?
ygData.msgSnippet: You need to install numarray , since the windows version is linked to this package as opposed to numpy .   Both packages have similar functionality. More

Content-Type: text/plain;
 charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

You need to install "numarray", since the windows version is linked to
this
package as opposed to "numpy".   Both packages have similar
functionality.
More information can be found on this at:
http://www.scipy.org/History_of_SciPy
 
Dave H.

>>> hlzhou05@... 5/21/2006 2:38 AM >>>

To whom it may concerns:
   I want to use cantera as a substitute for chemkin II, and I've
downloaded the files needed for installation today. But I am not able
to successfully run the demo programs in Python after trying a couple
of installations. 
   The procedures I followed  are listed here:
   1. run "ActivePython-2.4.3.12-win32-x86.msi";
      install to c:\python32
   2. run  "numpy-0.9.8.win32-py2.4.exe"
      automatically detected the directory "c:\python32"
   3. run "Cantera160r3.msi";
      install to "d:\program files\cantera"
   Down below is one of the error messages I encountered while trying
to run demo programs. 
   Thank you in advance !


traceback (most recent call last):
File"C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\pythonwin\pywin\framework\scriptutils.py",
line 310, in RunScript
    exec codeObject in __main__.__dict__
File "D:\Program
Files\Cantera\demos\Python\gasdynamics\isentropic.py", line 1, in ?
    from Cantera import *
File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\__init__.py", line 7, in ?
    import _cantera
ImportError: No module named numarray.libnumeric
>>> 
        
        ERROR: numarray not found!
        
        Cantera uses a set of numerical extensions to Python, but these
do
        not appear to be present on your system. To install the
required
        package, go to http://sourceforge.net/projects/numpy, and
install
        either the numarray package for your system. If you are
        using a Windows system, use the binary installer to install
the
        selected package for you automatically.
        
        
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File
"C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\pythonwin\pywin\framework\scriptutils.py",
line 310, in RunScript
    exec codeObject in __main__.__dict__
  File "D:\Program Files\Cantera\demos\Python\transport\dustygas.py",
line 12, in ?
    from Cantera import *
  File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\__init__.py", line 10, in
?
    from gases import *
  File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\gases.py", line 8, in ?
    import solution, constants
  File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\solution.py", line 5, in
?
    from ThermoPhase import ThermoPhase
  File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\ThermoPhase.py", line 4,
in ?
    from Cantera.num import zeros
  File "C:\Python24\Lib\site-packages\Cantera\num.py", line 24, in ?
    raise "could not import "+_cantera.nummod
could not import numarray












Yahoo! Groups Links
